column5: Looks like a great outing. Enjoy the many fish fries.
There are some real hawgs there!  Do you guys jig for them, or fish minnows, or ??? Doug
Fish the bottom with pickerel rigs/minnows in 45-70FOW.
Very interesting indeed, that they are so deep.  I imagine you must catch the odd walleye when perch fishing?  That would be a bonus!  (assuming walleye are open)
I've seen pics of a few Lakers coming off those perch grounds this spring , one was a real huge slob edit for pic :
I did alright on Friday but I didn't stick with the crowd of boats.. I watched the electronics and only put a line down when I saw them on the graph..
Wow! Haven't seen many, if any lakers come out of Erie! Nice fish!
It's not uncommon to get walleye while perch fishing on Erie. A couple years ago I landed a 13lb channel cat on perch gear.
Are you fishing out of Ft Erie?
Most of the boats were concentrated near crystal beach.. it would seem the the fish have now scattered so it's a guessing game as to where they are...
